info.description: This is an API Gateway webServer
info.title: API Gateway

parameters.description: Number of entities in a response
parameters.name: size

put.description: Update a Connection. Results is updated Connection.

post.description: Create a Connection. Results is created Connection.

get.description: Get a decrypted Connection by id

post.description: Send feedback about previously made prediction
post.summary: Send feedback about previously made prediction

parameters.name: size

post.description: Create a Model  Results is created Model

delete.description: Delete a Model deployment by id

get.description: Get the user information(email, name and so on)

type.description:
Type of the backend. Available values:
   * local
   * config

localBackendCrdPath.description: Path to a dir with ODAHU CRDs

apiToken.description: It is a mock for the future. Currently, it is always empty.

clientId.description: OpenID client_id credential for service account

clientSecret.description: OpenID client_secret credential for service account

externalUrls.description: The collection of external urls, for example: metrics, edge, service catalog and so on

resourceGpuName.description:
Kubernetes can consume the GPU resource in the <vendor>.com/gpu format.
For example, amd.com/gpu or nvidia.com/gpu.

enabled.description: Connection API server and operator are enabled

repositoryType.description:
Storage backend for connections. Available options:
  * kubernetes
  * vault

imageUrl.description: Optional link to an image which represents a type of the resource, for example the logo of Grafana

defaultDockerPullConnName.description: Default connection ID which will be used if a user doesn't specify it in a model deployment

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace, where model deployments will be deployed

nodePools.description: Node pools to run training tasks on

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace, where model trainings will be deployed

nodePools.description: Node pools to run packaging tasks on

packagingIntegrationRepositoryType.description:
Storage backend for packaging integrations. Available options:
  * kubernetes
  * postgres

tolerations.description: Kubernetes tolerations for model packaging pods

gpuNodePools.description: Node pools to run GPU training tasks on

gpuTolerations.description: Kubernetes tolerations for GPU model trainings pods

namespace.description: Kubernetes namespace, where model trainings will be deployed

nodePools.description: Node pools to run training tasks on

tolerations.description: Kubernetes tolerations for model trainings pods

toolchainIntegrationRepositoryType.description:
Storage backend for toolchain integrations. Available options:
  * kubernetes
  * postgres

mpFile.description: The path to the configuration file for a user packager.

outputDir.description: The path to the dir when a user packager will save their result.

mtFile.description: The path to the configuration file for a user trainer.

outputDir.description: The path to the dir when a user trainer will save their result.

signOutUrl.description: The sign out endpoint logs out the authenticated

insecure.description: Can be used to debug and local development. Skip TLS verification

role.description: Vault role for access to the secret engine path

secretEnginePath.description: Vault secret engine path where connection will be stored

token.description:
Optionally. Token for access to the vault server
If it is empty then client will use the k8s auth

modelHolder.description: Connection where a trained model artifact is stored

targets.description: List of targets with appropriate connections

trainingZipName.description: Name of trained model artifact name

arguments.description: List of arguments. This parameter depends on the specific packaging integration

image.description: Image name. Packaging integration image will be used if this parameters is missed

nodeSelector.description: Node selector for specifying a node pool

outputConnection.description:
Name of Connection to storage where a packager obtain a model trained artifact.
Permitted connection types are defined by specific PackagingIntegration

resources.description:
Resources for packager container
The same format like k8s uses for pod resources.

targets.description: List of targets. This parameter depends on the specific packaging integration

entrypoint.description: Path to binary which starts a packaging process

schema.description: Schema which describes targets and arguments for specific packaging integration

type.description:
Required value. Available values:
  * s3
  * gcs
  * azureblob
  * git
  * docker

remotePath.description: Overwrite remote data path in connection

imagePullConnID.description: If pulling of your image requires authorization, then you should specify the connection id

livenessProbeInitialDelay.description: Initial delay for liveness probe of model pod

maxReplicas.description: Maximum number of pods for model. By default the max replicas parameter equals 1.

minReplicas.description: Minimum number of pods for model. By default the min replicas parameter equals 0.

nodeSelector.description: Node selector for specifying a node pool

readinessProbeInitialDelay.description: Initial delay for readiness probe of model pod

resources.description:
Resources for model deployment
The same format like k8s uses for pod resources.

roleName.description: Initial delay for readiness probe of model pod

replicas.description: Expected number of pods under current load

state.description:
The state of a model 
  "Processing" - A model was not deployed. Because some parameters of the
                 custom resource are wrong. For example, there is not a model
                 image in a Docker registry.
  "Ready" - A model was deployed successfully.

weight.description: The proportion of traffic to be forwarded to the Model Deployment.

name.description: Name of a result. It can be docker image, path to s3 artifact and so on

mirror.description:
Mirror HTTP traffic to a another Model deployment in addition to forwarding
the requests to the model deployments.

modelDeployments.description: A http rule can forward traffic to Model Deployments.

urlPrefix.description:
URL prefix for model  For example: /custom/test
Prefix must start with slash
"/feedback" and "/model" are reserved for internal usage

edgeUrl.description: Full url with prefix to a model deployment service

entrypoint.description: Model training file. It can be python\bash script or jupiter notebook

envs.description: Custom environment variables that should be set before entrypoint invocation.

hyperParameters.description: Model training hyperParameters in parameter:value format

nodeSelector.description: Node selector for specifying a node pool

outputConnection.description:
Name of Connection to storage where training output artifact will be stored.
Permitted connection types are defined by specific toolchain

resources.description:
Resources for model container
The same format like k8s uses for pod resources.

vcsName.description: Name of Connection resource. Must exists

workDir.description: Directory with model scripts/files in a git repository

cpu.description: Read more about CPU resource here https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-compute-resources-container/#meaning-of-cpu

gpu.description: Read more about GPU resource here https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/manage-gpus/scheduling-gpus/#using-device-plugins

memory.description: Read more about memory resource here https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-compute-resources-container/#meaning-of-memory

limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed.

requests.description: Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required.

additionalEnvironments.description: Additional environments for a training process

entrypoint.description: Path to binary which starts a training process
